1.text: Tear the rib from fresh leaves, then add them to your dish.

2.text: Remove the whole leaves before you serve the dish.

3.text: Slice the leaves finely to include them throughout your dish.

4.text: Store fresh leaves in the refrigerator for 2 weeks.

5.text: Simmer dried leaves in your dish to impart their flavor.

6.text: Eat around the dried leaves or remove them before you serve your food.

7.text: Sprinkle a pinch of kaffir leaf powder into a dish to add a subtle flavor.

8.text: Pair kaffir lime leaves with other Thai flavors.

9.text: Try adding kaffir lime leaves to fish and shellfish dishes.

10.text: Add kaffir lime leaves to add a bright citrus flavor to curry.

11.text: Use the lime leaves to give your rice an extra layer of flavor.

12.text: Add the leaves to a sweet dish to make a citrusy dessert.

13.text: Add a few leaves to your potpourri to add a citrus aroma.

14.text: Place the leaves in your bath to add a pleasant scent.

15.text: Rub the leaves on your skin as a natural perfume.

16.text: Tuck the leaves into a wreath to add a pleasant aroma.
